section.title: Introduction
section.p:
The freezer-agent is a tool that is used to take manual backups and perform manual restores.
It can be run from any place you want to take a backup (or do a restore) because all HPE Helion OpenStack nodes have the freezer-agent installedon them. To use it, you should run as root.

For , you must follow these steps to perform backups:
Define what you want to backup.
Define a mode for that backup. The following modes are available:
FS (filesystem) (default)
MySQL
SQL Server
Mongo It is recommended that you use snapshots if the mode is MySQL, SQL Server, or Mongo.
Define whether to use a snapshot in the file system for the backup:
In Unix systems LVM is used (when available).
In Windows systems virtual shadow copies are used.
Define a storage media in a job from the following list:
Swift (requires OpenStack credentials)(default)
Local (no credentials required)
SSH (no credentials required) (not implemented on Windows)

body.section:
Basic Configuration for Backups
There are several mandatory parameters you need to specify in order to execute a backup. Note storage is optional:
action (backup by default)
mode (fs by default)
path-to-backup
backup-name
container (Swift container or local path)
storage is not mandatory. It is Swift by default For , you can create a backup using only mandatory values, as in the following example: - freezer-agent --action backup --mode fs --storage swift --path-to-backup /home/user/tmp --container tmp_backups --backup-name backup1 To create a configuration file for this same backup, the file would look like the one below. Note that in the config file, the parameter names such as backup-name will use underscores instead of dashes. Thus backup-name as used in the CLI will be backup_name when used in the config file. Note also that where you use -- in the CLI, such as --mode, you do not use the -- in the config file. { "job_actions": [ { "freezer_action": { "action": "backup", "mode": "fs", "backup_name": "backup1", "path_to_backup": "/home/user/tmp", "container": "tmp_backups" }, "max_retries": 3, "max_retries_interval": 60 } ], "job_schedule": { "schedule_interval": "24 hours" }, "description": "backup for tmp dir" }
In this configuration file (JSON), the freezer command is wrapped in the "freezer_action" key. For , we can define the schedule rules that this job will follow (only available through the configuration file) and a brief description of the job.

section.title: Restoring your Data
section.p:
For , you must do the following in order to restore data after a backup:
Select a backup to restore.
Define a mode for the restore: The following modes are available:
FS (filesystem) (default)
MySQL
SQL Server
Mongo
If the restore involves an application (such as MySQL) remember to shut down the application or service and start it again after the restore.

section.title: Basic Configuration for Restoring
section.p: To restore from a backup, note that in some cases you must stop the service (for instance, MySQL) before the restore.

There are several parameters that are required and there are some optional parameters used to execute a restore:
action (backup by default)
mode (fs by default)
restore-abs-path
backup-name
container (Swift container or local path)
restore-from-host
restore-from-date (optional)
storage is not mandatory. It is Swift by default

You can create a restore using mandatory values, as in the following example: - freezer-agent --action restore --mode fs --storage swift --restore-abs-path /home/user/tmp --container tmp_backups --backup-name backup1 --restore-from-host ubuntu

To create a configuration file for this same restore, the file would look like the one below. Note that in the config file, the parameter names such as backup-name will use underscores instead of dashes. Thus backup-name as used in the CLI will be backup_name when used in the config file. Note also that where you use -- in the CLI, such as --mode, you do not use the -- in the config file. This is the same format as used above for backup configuration. { "job_actions": [ { "freezer_action": { "action": "restore", "mode": "fs", "backup_name": "backup1", "restore_abs_path": "/home/user/tmp", "container": "tmp_backups", "restore_from_host": "ubuntu" }, "max_retries": 3, "max_retries_interval": 60 } ], "description": "backup for tmp dir" }
